title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Westlake, LA

content.rendered:
Are you looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA? Los Angeles is also known as “The City of Angels”, and we have many, many more facts to hit you with before you pay a visit to this sunny state!

For example, during the early 20th century, Westlake was known as the Champs-Élysées of Los Angeles. Then, by the late 20th century, as the domain of the notorious MS-13. However, Roomi is here to provide the facts to meet your modern-day needs – from rooms for rent to restaurants in Westlake, LA.

Read to learn more about the average rent in Westlake LA, including neighboring locations, safety, recreational venues, and the few eclectic markets and restaurants in Westlake LA.

Where is Westlake, L.A.?

Westlake District is a densely-populated residential-commercial town with a bustling city-life environment in Los Angeles, California.

When you’re out looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA, if you ask for directions, most people will direct you to Westlake Village – a suburb of L.A. So, make sure to ask/enter Westlake District, L.A., next to MacArthur Park, which everybody knows. Some cool places like Downtown, Hollywood, Koreatown, Silver Lake, etc., are just a few minutes away.

The neighborhood is in Central Los Angeles, which includes Central City, Central City North, Hollywood, Westlake, and Wilshire. The Westlake CPA (Community Plan Area), includes Historic Filipinotown (HiFi) and Temple–Beaudry.

The northern limit of the neighborhood is marked by freeway US 101 and the southern by Echo Park and Silver Lake. From the south, it enters Hollywood where Route 66 takes a left along Santa Monica Blvd.

Find Rooms For Rent in Westlake

Find Rooms For Rent In Westlake, LA

Looking for rooms for rent in Westlake is an inexpensive alternative to downtown. The area’s recent gentrification has many young and unmarried people looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA. For this reason, you’ll find multiple-unit dwellings and apartment buildings when looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA.

With roughly 65% foreign-born residents, most people here are working-class immigrants from Latin America. For the most part, people are family-oriented and hard-working. Overall, it’s a respectable location, filled with various ethnic diversities living peacefully amongst each other. The average rent in Westlake, LA is also pretty reasonable when compared to downtown living.

Average Rent in Westlake, LA

Check out neighboring communities like Downtown, East Hollywood, Echo Park, Koreatown, Rampart Village, Pico-Union and Silver Lake, when looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA.

The town’s density has its advantages, such as many rendezvous spots clumped within a few square miles. There are also a number of nearby places for those who prefer a calm, easy pace.

As busy and hectic as Westlake is, in nearby Koreatown you’ll find shops and markets to stop at while you explore. In addition, you’ll discover selective book stores to browse through for a quiet afternoon.

Is Westlake, LA safe?

Generally, the neighborhood’s notorious past is riddled with gang dramas. However, crime has drastically dropped in recent years. It’s not uncommon to find someone – mostly harmless – digging through your garbage to pick out anything of value. Be nice and keep the peace as much as possible – they’re probably looking for their next meal.

There is much in Westlake to enjoy, but keep your wits about you after dark. Recently, security measures to keep drugs and users out of the parks in Westlake LA have improved. Even still, try not to venture out alone at night.

The LAPD’s Rampart Division patrols communities west of downtown including Westlake, Pico-Union, Echo Park, and Silver Lake.

Website

Here are some important numbers, in case you ever need them:

  • 911: for life-threatening emergencies – fire, ambulance, and police.
  • 1-877-275-5273: non-emergency crimes.

For reporting other criminal activities, check out the below LAPD website.

Report a Crime

Public Transit in Westlake, LA

Westlake has one main heavy-rail line station and to some extent is bike-able. Parking is horrendous – you’ve been warned! It’s recommended you use the public transit options as much as possible.

1. Walkability

With a walk score of 91 the neighborhood is the 5th most walkable in LA. Most daily errands can be accomplished conveniently on foot.

2. Roads & Traffic

Parking is a pain and you may struggle to find a spot to leave your car. Where possible, use public transport.

  • For impounded or recovered vehicles: 213-250-0143.

3. Nearby Train Stations

Westlake/MacArthur Park station, as the name suggests, is across from MacArthur Park. Lines that service this neighborhood are B (red) & D (purple).

4. Nearby Bus Stops

Bus lines that service the area are 200, 603, 720, and DASH.

Also, check below for the Moovit App to find real-time schedules and directions for bus or subway routes passing through Westlake/MacArthur Park Station.

Moovit App

Restaurants in Westlake, LA

When you’re looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA, you get to eat among the real-life angels! Read on to discover three must-try restaurants in Westlake LA, hand-picked just for you!

1. Langer’s Deli

An LA institution for hot pastrami on crispy-crust rye, this restaurant continues to delight first-timers and regulars. From fantastic dinner entrees to hot pastrami, roast beef, corned beef and delightful side orders, this is one of the must-visit restaurants in Westlake LA.

Website
Directions
Online Order

2. Original Tommy’s World Famous Hamburgers

Out of the few restaurants in Westlake LA, we recommend Original Tommy’s. Founded in 1946, in a modest-small stand by Greek immigrants, today this place has global write-ups, with good reason. Here you’ll find excellent high-quality, low-priced food, like a breakfast menu and world-famous tamales, hamburgers, french fries, hot dogs, and chili fries.

Website
Menu / Order Online

3. Shabuya

All you can eat, from veggies, noodles to meats and seafood with great soups! Traditional, wholesome Japanese cuisine with Korean wine and sake, this place is pricer than most, but it’s all you can eat – so you can get your dollar’s worth!

Website
Menu
Directions

Parks in Westlake, LA

As mentioned previously, when looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA, be sure to look near MacArthur Park. You’ll find a few restaurants in Westlake LA that dot the areas around its few parks, for a quick bite as you explore.

  • MacArthur Park: is a historic location with a colorful past. The Wilshire Boulevard divides the park in two: north and south. The south of the park has a lake, while the north comprises picnic tables, an amphitheatre, a children’s playground, soccer fields, and a bandshell, along with a recreation center. Every summer between June and September, the park organizes numerous free music concerts ranging jazz, world, beat, and other genres.
  • Vista Hermosa Natural Park: The park features oak savannahs, picnic grounds, walking trails, streams, and a nature-themed playground with mediterranean verdant surroundings, and includes a FIFA-regulation soccer field. In addition, it has an outdoor amphitheater that holds environmental and natural history education, and other public events.
Vista Hermosa Natural Park

Recreational Activities

When looking for rooms for rent in Westlake LA, we recommend you consider the fun things to do in and around the area. We’ve curated a few places for you to visit to enjoy recreational activities.

  • Westlake Theater: Historic, dramatic, and with a story to tell. Like the neighborhood, most places here have stories. And of course, this location also has interesting restaurants in Westlake LA.
  • Jimenez Arcade: A place that adults and children can enjoy with billiards, pool tables, and video games. Click for directions.
  • Hatch Escapes: As the name suggests, set yourself free. Check out this quirky concept with friends or family to enjoy a challenge assessing your sense of direction, coordination, and communication.
  • Koreatown: Visit one of the densest neighborhoods in the US. Discover, explore, shop, eat, and see.

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Westlake, LA? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
